Articles.Content:
Corporations always say they will leave the company under local control.  I once worked for a company who's entire mantra was exactly that (Dover Corporation).  They claimed to purchase successful companies and put them under their umbrella but leave them under the local control of the company.  They one day they decided they wanted to step in and reorganize an industry leader company, screwed it up, and now it has been shut down entirely and replaced by it's next biggest competitor (who they also bought) and that company is faltering as well because if their meddling.

Pardon me if I don't trust corporate lies, but I've been around that block a few times.  Make no mistake, Squad is not in control of their development any longer.

Been around since Pong. Ive seen many changes and lots of things come and go. I wish I could share the enthusiasm some of you have. This could go either way. No doubt about one thing though, things are going to change. No one buys a company to just sit back and watch, they make changes. Honestly, no one knows how this will end and thats as truthful as anyone can be. I hope and wish for the best though.
Hopefully the Linux version will continue to be updated too

Speaking as someone who has literally been here almost from the start, I'm pretty dang happy with this. It can't really go badly wrong - KSP could only continue being developed for so long before it stopped being profitable, maybe much more will get done in that timespan now. Maybe that timespan will be larger, who knows. I love squad and all, but the problems that have spanned multiple versions, defying so many attempts at fixing... maybe some of them can get resolved now, depending on what kind of resources KSP will have access to. Either way, I've gotten 6 years out of a game I got with a $7 donation, which is fine by me. I still have most of my previous installs, taking up quite a number of gigabytes - even if this goes horribly wrong, I can fall back on those for at least another thousand or two hours.

-Edit- As the dude below said, KSP 2 could be a thing. A thing from a big company. I'd be a jibbering mess merely at its announcement.

--Edit- Just got to thinking, will the free dlc/expansions still be honored?

Edited June 1, 2017 by TheUnamusedFox

I won't be surprised if KSP continues to get developed/ maintained by Squad, all the while another developer in the Take-Two umbrella is given KSP 2 to work on. As has been said many times in this thread, you don't buy a whole IP to not use it and I don't see DLC or console ports alone recouping that cost. 

Not saying this is good or bad, just my guess at will happen.

3 minutes ago, Orionkermin said:

I won't be surprised if KSP continues to get developed/ maintained by Squad, all the while another developer in the Take-Two umbrella is given KSP 2 to work on.

I, for one, would love to see another developer's take on KSP. KSP is a fantastic idea with a somewhat sub-par implementation. I doubt any developer with the chops and seriousness to actually plan out their game would fail at a second KSP if they retained the core sandbox gameplay.

58 minutes ago, Alshain said:

 Make no mistake, Squad is not in control of their development any longer.

Hurray!

Incidentally, I'd like to point out that I - and likely many of us - found out about this not only on these forums but in this very thread. In the past I - and many of us - have given some grief that major announcements only found their way here through some sort of trickle-down mechanism.

Thank you for putting this up here so quickly!

I congratulate the KSP team for making this purchase happen.  Having TakeTwo onboard will provide necessary resources to make KSP better.

Saying that I have two mayor concerns with "growing" this already great game.  Growth requires to have a purpose otherwise growth for the sake of growing is the motto of a cancer cell.

Concern 1 - DRM.  Currently with the exception of the Steam and Console versions it is not existent.  No DRM has more positives than negatives and having TakeTwo onboard may change that indie game option.

Concern 2 - Mods and Modders.  I enjoy Vanilla KSP but KSP+MODS takes the game to a different level that only modders can provide.  Take Two should embrace mods and modders as KSP team has done.  No exceptions.  Instead TakeTwo should provide tools and guidelines to modders to take the game to a different level.  DLC and mods can co-exist, it has been seen with KSP and many other game (i.e. ARMA, IL2, etc.)

I see the glass half full and just wish much success to all involved with such a great game: Kerbal Space Program.
Congratulations! I hope you guys make Kerbal Space Program 2 and it's on something OTHER than the very limited Unity engine.

Interesting development. I'll reserve judgement until I see what their plans for KSP development are.
